notes.text: These are all security issues fixed in the firefox-esr-128.6.0-1.1 package on the GA media of openSUSE Tumbleweed.
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

full_product_name.name: firefox-esr-128.6.0-1.1.aarch64 as component of openSUSE Tumbleweed
firefox-esr-128.6.0-1.1.ppc64le as component of openSUSE Tumbleweed
firefox-esr-128.6.0-1.1.s390x as component of openSUSE Tumbleweed
firefox-esr-128.6.0-1.1.x86_64 as component of openSUSE Tumbleweed

notes.text: The WebChannel API, which is used to transport various information across processes, did not check the sending principal but rather accepted the principal being sent. This could have led to privilege escalation attacks. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 134, Firefox ESR < 128.6, Thunderbird < 134, and Thunderbird ESR < 128.6.
notes.title: CVE description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: Assuming a controlled failed memory allocation, an attacker could have caused a use-after-free, leading to a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 134, Firefox ESR < 128.6, Firefox ESR < 115.19, Thunderbird < 134, and Thunderbird ESR < 128.6.
notes.title: CVE description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: When using Alt-Svc, ALPN did not properly validate certificates when the original server is redirecting to an insecure site. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 134, Firefox ESR < 128.6, Thunderbird < 134, and Thunderbird ESR < 128.6.
notes.title: CVE description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: Parsing a JavaScript module as JSON could, under some circumstances, cause cross-compartment access, which may result in a use-after-free. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 134, Firefox ESR < 128.6, Thunderbird < 134, and Thunderbird ESR < 128.6.
notes.title: CVE description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: When segmenting specially crafted text, segmentation would corrupt memory leading to a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 134, Firefox ESR < 128.6, Thunderbird < 134, and Thunderbird ESR < 128.6.
notes.title: CVE description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 133, Thunderbird 133, Firefox ESR 115.18, Firefox ESR 128.5, Thunderbird 115.18, and Thunderbird 128.5. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 134, Firefox ESR < 128.6, Firefox ESR < 115.19, Thunderbird < 134, and Thunderbird ESR < 128.6.
notes.title: CVE description

remediations.details: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 133, Thunderbird 133, Firefox ESR 128.5, and Thunderbird 128.5. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 134, Firefox ESR < 128.6, Thunderbird < 134, and Thunderbird ESR < 128.6.
notes.title: CVE description
